subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: ... Here s one possibility.  Deviations from X-SAMPA are given in parens. Pea p Bay b Tea t Day d Key k Gay g Thaw T They D Fee f Vie v See s Zoo z She S Jai Z
messageBody:
Ted Larson Freeman scripsit:

> But then I suppose a careful attempt to come up with single ASCII
> characters to correspond to the 44 QS symbols based on X-SAMPA might
> be difficult. I haven't tried yet.

Here's one possibility. Deviations from X-SAMPA are given in parens.

Pea p
Bay b
Tea t
Day d
Key k
Gay g
Thaw T
They D
Fee f
Vie v
See s
Zoo z
She S
Jai Z
Cheer c (X-SAMPA: tS)
Jay J (X-SAMPA: dZ)
Ye j
Way w
He h
Why W
Ing N
May m
No n
Low l
Roe r
It I
Eat i
Et E
Eight e (X-SAMPA: eI or EI)
At a (X-SAMPA: left curly bracket)
I Y (X-SAMPA: aI)
Ah A
Awe O
Ox Q
Oy R (as in Roy; X-SAMPA: OI)
Utter y (X-SAMPA: @ or V)
Out H (as in How; X-SAMPA: aU)
Owe o (X-SAMPA: ou or @u or OU)
Foot U
OOze u
Llan K
Loch x
Ax X (X-SAMPA: ks)
Exam G (X-SAMPA: gz)

Of course, some of the original X-SAMPA decisions are arbitrary too,
notably Q and K (there's just nothing to be done about the fact
that there are gobs of l-like letters in IPA and only one k-like letter).

> And also Kirshenbaum notation: http://www.kirshenbaum.net/IPA/

Kirsh has been mostly replaced by X-SAMPA.

> Is there anyone else who'd like to see changes in the keyboard mappings?

I would. However, there at least two caveats:

1) It would be a very considerable change to everyone who's used
to the existing system (if not as drastic as changing from TO to QS!)

2) As I've hammered home over the past month, this is an IPA-ization
of only some accents.

--
By Elbereth and Luthien the Fair, you shall cowan@...
have neither the Ring nor me! --Frodo http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
